episodeTitle: Nami's Soul Cries Out! Straw Hat Luffy Makes a Comeback!
episodeTitleJapanese: ナミ魂の叫び！麦わらのルフィ復活！
episodeTitleRomanized: Nami tamashii no sakebi! Mugiwara no Rufi fukkatsu!
description: As the devastating Aqua Laguna approaches Water 7, Nami desperately reaches Luffy to inform him of Robin's sacrifice. Chopper finds Zoro trapped in a chimney and delivers his sword. Meanwhile, at Enies Lobby, Spandam eagerly awaits Robin's arrival with his sword Funkfreed.

events.title: Funkfreed's First Appearance
events.description: Spandam is seen at Enies Lobby eating with his sword Funkfreed, which has consumed the Zou Zou no Mi Devil Fruit. Spandam expresses his eagerness for CP9 to bring him Robin and Franky.
events.significance: Introduction of Funkfreed, a sword that has consumed a Zoan-type Devil Fruit, showcasing the unique ability of objects to possess Devil Fruit powers through Vegapunk's technology.

quotes.text: Admiral Aokiji was generous enough to have me control many government agents and battleships. I can't wait until CP9 brings me Robin and Cutty Flam.
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam expressing his anticipation while at Enies Lobby

events.title: Nami Braves the Aqua Laguna
events.description: Nami descends from the rooftops toward Luffy's location as onlookers remark how brave but reckless her actions are. The massive Aqua Laguna wave looms in the background.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's character growth and her dedication to her crew, willing to risk her life in the deadly storm to inform Luffy about Robin.

quotes.text: That woman is crazy! The Aqua Laguna is coming!
quotes.speaker: Water 7 Citizen

events.title: Nami Reveals Robin's Sacrifice
events.description: Nami finally reaches Luffy and tells him that Robin sacrificed herself to protect the Straw Hats from CP9 and the World Government. She explains that Robin is being taken to Enies Lobby to prevent them from being attacked.
events.significance: Critical revelation that motivates Luffy and the crew to launch their assault on Enies Lobby. This moment marks the emotional turning point that drives the entire Enies Lobby arc.

quotes.text: Robin sacrificed herself! She's going to Enies Lobby to die so that we won't be attacked by the World Government!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami crying while informing Luffy about Robin's situation

events.title: Chopper Finds Zoro in the Chimney
events.description: Chopper spots what he initially thinks is a sea anemone in a chimney, but discovers it's actually Zoro stuck upside down. Chopper rushes at great speed to help his crewmate.
events.significance: Comedic moment that also demonstrates the crew's determination to regroup despite the dire circumstances. Sets up Zoro's escape.

quotes.text: A sea anemone? No wait... that's Zoro!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper spotting Zoro stuck in the chimney

events.title: Luffy Breaks Free from Buildings
events.description: Using his rubber powers and raw strength, Luffy pushes apart the two buildings he was stuck between, freeing himself just as the Aqua Laguna approaches.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's determination and physical strength, showing his readiness to rescue Robin.

events.title: Chopper Delivers Sandai Kitetsu to Zoro
events.description: Chopper retrieves one of Zoro's swords, the Sandai Kitetsu, and brings it to him while he's trapped in the chimney, enabling Zoro to cut himself free.
events.significance: Shows the crew working together and Chopper's resourcefulness in helping his nakama.

events.title: Zoro Escapes the Chimney
events.description: With his Sandai Kitetsu in hand, Zoro uses a three-sword technique to slice through the chimney and free himself from his predicament.
events.significance: Zoro's escape allows him to rejoin the crew for the upcoming rescue mission.

events.title: Aqua Laguna Destroys the Backstreets
events.description: The massive Aqua Laguna wave crashes into Water 7's backstreets with devastating force. The skyscraper-high wave destroys buildings and threatens to kill everyone in its path.
events.significance: Demonstrates the natural disaster that threatens Water 7 annually and raises the stakes for the trapped Straw Hats. Shows the power of nature in the One Piece world.

events.title: Paulie Saves the Crew with Rope Action
events.description: Using his Rope Action technique, Paulie throws his ropes to grab Luffy, Nami, Zoro, and Chopper, pulling them all to safety on the rooftops just as the Aqua Laguna engulfs the backstreets.
events.significance: Showcases Paulie's unique fighting style and rope abilities. Demonstrates his commitment to helping the Straw Hats despite the earlier conflicts.

quotes.text: Grab on! I'll pull you up!
quotes.speaker: Paulie
quotes.context: Paulie using his ropes to rescue the Straw Hats from the Aqua Laguna

events.title: Sanji Defeats Government Agents on Sea Train
events.description: On the Sea Train heading to Enies Lobby, Sanji finishes defeating all the government agents in his train car, clearing the way forward.
events.significance: Shows Sanji making progress toward rescuing Robin and demonstrates his combat prowess against multiple government agents.

quotes.text: Time to move forward and save Robin!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji after defeating the agents in his car

events.title: Nami Scolds Luffy for Laughing at Zoro
events.description: After being rescued, Luffy laughs at Zoro for getting stuck in a chimney. Nami angrily pulls Luffy's face, reminding him that he did something similar by getting stuck between buildings twice.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief in a tense episode while showcasing the crew's dynamic and Nami's role as the voice of reason.

quotes.text: Don't laugh at him! You got stuck between buildings twice yourself!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami scolding Luffy for laughing at Zoro

events.title: Luffy Declares They Will Rescue Robin
events.description: After learning of Robin's sacrifice, Luffy stands up with determination and declares that they must set out and rescue Robin right away. The Straw Hats prepare to make their move toward Enies Lobby.
events.significance: This declaration marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' assault on Enies Lobby, one of the most significant arcs in One Piece. It demonstrates Luffy's unwavering loyalty to his crew.

quotes.text: We're going to rescue Robin, right now!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring the crew's next mission

quotes.text: Robin sacrificed herself! She's going to Enies Lobby to die so that we won't be attacked by the World Government!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami revealing Robin's sacrifice to Luffy

quotes.text: We're going to rescue Robin, right now!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

themes.description: The episode explores Robin's sacrifice for her crew and the Straw Hats' unwavering loyalty to rescue her, demonstrating the deep bonds of nakama.
themes.symbolism: The Aqua Laguna represents the overwhelming obstacles the crew must overcome, yet they persist despite the danger.

themes.description: Luffy and the crew face multiple challenges - being physically trapped, the deadly Aqua Laguna, and the might of the World Government - yet remain determined to save Robin.
themes.symbolism: Luffy breaking free from the buildings symbolizes breaking free from all constraints to protect his nakama.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the theme of nakama through the crew's dedication to rescuing Robin and their willingness to face any danger for each other.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member helping one another escape their predicaments represents the interconnected nature of their friendship.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates immense bravery by descending through the dangerous Aqua Laguna to inform Luffy about Robin. Her tearful revelation shows her deep care for her crewmates.
keyActions: Escapes the wave with the crew
quotes: Robin sacrificed herself! She's going to Enies Lobby to die so that we won't be attacked by the World Government!

characterSpotlights.development: Upon learning of Robin's sacrifice, Luffy immediately commits to rescuing her, showing his unwavering dedication to his crew. His determination reignites despite the dire circumstances.
keyActions: Breaks free from buildings using strength
Learns about Robin's sacrifice from Nami
Declares the crew will rescue Robin
quotes: We're going to rescue Robin, right now!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper shows his resourcefulness and care for his crew by finding Zoro and delivering his sword, enabling his escape.
quotes: A sea anemone? No wait... that's Zoro!

characterSpotlights.development: Paulie demonstrates his growing alliance with the Straw Hats by using his rope abilities to rescue them from the Aqua Laguna, solidifying his support for their cause.
keyActions: Uses Rope Action to save the Straw Hats
Pulls crew to safety from Aqua Laguna
Assists in their mission to rescue Robin
quotes: Grab on! I'll pull you up!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several comedic moments, including Luffy laughing at Zoro being stuck in the chimney and Nami's reaction, which were briefer in the manga.
The Aqua Laguna destruction sequence was more visually dramatic and extended in the anime compared to the manga panels.
Sanji's fight scenes against government agents on the Sea Train were expanded with more action choreography in the anime.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode where Kazue Ikura voices Tony Tony Chopper, temporarily replacing Ikue Otani who was on maternity leave. Ikura would voice Chopper for episodes 254-263.
Kazue Ikura, who temporarily voiced Chopper in this episode, would later go on to voice Marine Captain Sentomaru in the series.

sources.title: One Piece / The Other Darrin - TV Tropes

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Funkfreed, one of the few inanimate objects in One Piece to have consumed a Devil Fruit, made possible through Vegapunk's technology.
The ending song 'Dear Friends' by TRIPLANE is dedicated to the Going Merry and would later play during Merry's funeral in Episode 312.
Episode 254 adapts content from three manga chapters: Chapter 363 (pages 2-19), Chapter 364 (pages 2-9), and Chapter 365 (pages 2-5).
The opening song 'Kokoro no Chizu' (Map of the Heart) by BOYSTYLE was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen format and the first that Funimation did not dub, providing only subtitles.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki
